comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: The date given by LOC states between 1910 and 1915, however, assuming this photo was taken at one of the two Battles of the Somme, this photo would need to be dated either 1916 or 1918.

comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: The photo probably dates back to when the Germans first took the area in 1914.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Here's a news article describing battles there in September, 1914 ("CAPTURED AT HEAVY COST; Peronne Taken in Face of Deadly Fire From the German Guns. 900 DEAD IN ONE TRENCH Battle Fought in Wheat Field ;- Repeated German Assaults Were Repulsed") query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=980CE2DA1430E7...

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This is a cropped version of Agence Meurisse photo on Gallica site, with caption: "Cadavre allemand sur le champ de bataille de Fère Champenoise " [German corpse on the battefield of Fère Champenoise] Pub date 1914 gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/btv1b9041757x

comment._content: artolog:  Thanks for the additional info. here.  We'll include the date and the translated original title next time we update the description.

comment._content: There is nowhere to take cover in that open field.
